subject: Languages
title: How the Roman Empire Spread Latin
description: Learn How the Roman Empire Spread Latin in one minute.

hook.text: Rome didn't just conquer territory â€” it conquered languages, replacing them with Latin.

buildup.text: As legions marched from Spain to Romania, Latin became the language of law and trade.

discovery.text: Conquered peoples adopted Latin to access Roman courts, markets, and citizenship.

twist.text: Local languages didn't vanish instantly â€” they blended with Latin for centuries first.

climax.text: Iberian Celtic, Gaulish, and Dacian all left traces in the Romance languages they became.

punchline.text: Latin won by being useful, not by erasing what came before.

quiz.question: Why did conquered peoples adopt Latin?
options: To access Roman courts, markets, and citizenship
Rome forced everyone to speak it
Latin was easier than their languages
